src:
Atlet Jiujitsu Kabupaten Blitar Raih Medali Emas di Ajang Korea Open
06 Nov 2019, 18:56 by Sunarka Spt


Atlet Jiujitsu Kabupaten Blitar Raih Medali Emas di Ajang Korea Open

KBRN, Malang : Nura Amalia, atlet Jiujitsu asal kabupaten Blitar mampu mempersembahkan medali emas pada kejuaraan internasional Korea Open 2019. di kota Seol Korea Selatan.
Atlet muda muda berbakat berusia 20 tahun itu, mempersembahkan medali emas, setelah mampu menghentikan perlawanan atlit tuan rumah Minkyung Kim dan Monseo Kim. Atlet tuan rumah terpaksa harus puas dengan medali perak dan perunggu. 
Ketua umum KONI Kabupaten Blitar Toni Andreas mengabarkan, kesuksesan Nura Amalia di event internasional tersebut baru pertama kalinya di dapatkan.
"Norma baru pertama kalinya Go International pak, memang kemarin kita persiapkan untuk Porprov ternyata Jawa Timur Jiujitsu masih exebisi," terang Toni Andreas kepada RRI, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Menurutnya, ada penilaian tersendiri bagi Nura Amalia , sehingga diminta untuk masuk pelatnas mewakili Indonesia di kejuaraan internasional.
"Anak ini kan karena dilihat dari PB Jiujitsu Jakarta, Nora ini punya penilaian tersendiri ya, akhirnya di kirim ikut pelatnas mewakili Indonesia di event-event internasional," imbuhnya.
Ia menambahkan, Nura Amalia merupakan atlit yang sudah lama di persiapkan oleh KONI Kabupaten Blitar untuk Pekan Olahraga Provinsi (Porprov) dan Puslatda Jatim.
"Ini memang atlet yang sudah lama kita persiapkan untuk Porprov dan Puslatda," pungkasnya.
text:
Blitar Regency Jiujitsu Athlete Wins Gold Medal in Korean Open Event
Nov 06 2019, 18:56 by Sunarka Spt


Blitar Regency Jiujitsu Athlete Wins Gold Medal in Korean Open Event

KBRN, Malang: Nura Amalia, a Jiujitsu athlete from Blitar district, was able to present a gold medal at the 2019 Korea Open international championship in Seol, South Korea.
The talented young 20-year-old young athlete presents a gold medal, after being able to stop the resistance of host athletes Minkyung Kim and Monseo Kim. The host athlete was forced to be satisfied with silver and bronze medals.
Chairperson of KONI Blitar Regency Toni Andreas reported, the success of Nura Amalia at the international event was the first time to get.
"Norm is the first time Go International sir, indeed yesterday we prepared for Porprov it turns out that East Java Jiujitsu is still an exhibition," explained Toni Andreas to RRI, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
According to him, there was a separate assessment for Nura Amalia, so he was asked to enter the national training plate to represent Indonesia in the international championship.
"This child is because judging from PB Jiujitsu Jakarta, Nora has her own assessment, finally sent to participate in the national training representing Indonesia in international events," he added.
He added, Nura Amalia was an athlete that had long been prepared by KONI Blitar for the Provincial Sports Week (Porprov) and East Java Training Center.
"This is indeed an athlete that we have long prepared for Porprov and Puslatda," he concluded.
